reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: To reduce malaria incidence and deaths by at least 75 percent of the 2016 levels by 2023, working towards a malaria-free Kenya

description.narrative: Kenya - Malaria - Amref Health Africa in Kenya - Amref Kenya. This program has the following goals: To reduce morbidity and mortality caused by malaria in the various epidemiological zones by two thirds of the 2015 level by 2020. The objectives of this program are: To have at least80% of people living in malaria risk areas using appropriate malaria preventive interventions by 2020. To have 100% of all suspected malaria cases presenting to a health provider managed according to the national malaria treatment guidelines by 2020. To have at least80% of people living in malaria risk areas using appropriate malaria preventive interventions by 2020. To increase utilization of all malaria control interventions by target communities in Kenya to at least 80% by 2020 and sustain thereafter. Ensure that all levels (national, counties, sub-counties) provide reports on at least 80% of core malaria indicators according to the national M & E plan by 2020. To increase capacity in coordination, leadership, governance and resource mobilization at all levels towards achievement of the malaria program objectives by 2020

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for KEN-M-AMREF
CSS- Other 1: Number of CUs reporting on integrated TB, HIV and Malaria activities
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
CM- Other 1: Number of people with uncomplicated malaria receiving ACT treatment as per national treatment guidelines
HSS- Other 1: Number of functional Community units
M&E-Other: Timeliness of Community Health Unit (CHU) reporting: Percentage of submitted CHU monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines.
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Impact indicator for KEN-M-AMREF
Malaria test positivity rate
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Outcome indicator for KEN-M-AMREF
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Malaria O-other 1: % of patients with uncomplicated malaria managed according to guidelines at public health facilities
Malaria O- Other 2: Percentage of children <5years of age with fever who took any ACT the same or next day in the lake endemic region
Malaria O-Other 2: % of households with more than one ITN in endemic and epidemic regions
Malaria O- Other 1: Proportion of targetd striuctures sprayed per sray cycle
